analyzed: de'i steng du h'um kha dog mthing ga bsams la /

translated: The light rays from that

analyzed: bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / lha mo rnams dmigs te yid kyis mchod par bsam mo //
translated: visualize the guru, buddhas, bodhisattvas, and goddesses in the space in front, and imagine mental offerings.

original: 'od zer de nyid kyis sems can thams cad gsal bar byas la /
analyzed: 'od zer de nyid kyis sems can thams cad gsal bar byas la /
translated: Having illuminated all sentient beings with those very light rays,

analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should meditate on the four immeasurables.

analyzed: de'i rjes su chos thams cad stong pa nyid du sngags 'dis bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a: sva bh'a ba bhi shuddho& ham /
translated: Oṃ svabhāva śuddhāḥ sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho ’haṃ.

analyzed: de'i rjes su aom sh'u nya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes brjod pas //
translated: After that, by reciting oṃ śūnyatā jñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ,

original: snying ga'i nyi ma'i steng du h'um ye shes lnga'i ngo bo gsal ba nyid du dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: snying ga'i nyi ma'i steng du h'um ye shes lnga'i ngo bo gsal ba nyid du dmigs par bya'o //
translated: one should visualize a hūṃ on the sun at the heart, the nature of the five awarenesses.

original: 'od zer spros te @74b bgegs bsregs la /
analyzed: 'od zer spros te @74b bgegs bsregs la /
translated: Having emanated light rays, the obstructors are burned.

original: snying ga'i h'um yongs su gyur pa las //

translated: The hūṃ at the heart completely transforms

translated: into a five-pronged vajra, in the center of which is the syllable hūṃ.

original: de'i 'od zer gyis khams gsum gyi sems can thams cad sbyangs te /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis khams gsum gyi sems can thams cad sbyangs te /
translated: Light rays from that purify all sentient beings of the three realms.

original: 'od zer bsdus ma thag tu rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las dpal he ru ka sku mdog nag po zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: 'od zer bsdus ma thag tu rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las dpal he ru ka sku mdog nag po zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa /
translated: As soon as the light rays are retracted, the vajra completely transforms into glorious black Heruka with one face and two hands.

original: phyag g-yon pa na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga bsnams pa /
translated: He holds a skull and khaṭvāṅga in his left hand.

original: g-yas pa rdo rje 'phyar ba /
analyzed: g-yas pa rdo rje 'phyar ba /
translated: The right hand brandishes a vajra.

original: mche ba gtsigs pa /🔽ral pa dang thod pa'i dbu rgyan can /🔽spyi gtsug gi 'khor lo /
analyzed: mche ba gtsigs pa / ral pa dang thod pa'i dbu rgyan can / spyi gtsug gi 'khor lo /
translated: He bares his fangs.🔽He has a topknot and a crown of skulls.

original: rna rgyan / mgul rgyan /
analyzed: rna rgyan / mgul rgyan /
translated: He has a head ornament, earrings, a necklace,

original: dpung rgyan gdu bu dang ska rags kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: dpung rgyan gdu bu dang ska rags kyis brgyan pa /
translated: and is adorned with armlets, bracelets, and a belt.

original: mi mgo lnga bcu'i chun 'phyang can /
analyzed: mi mgo lnga bcu'i chun 'phyang can /
translated: He has a garland of fifty human heads.

original: skyil krung phyed pa'i gar stabs can /
analyzed: skyil krung phyed pa'i gar stabs can /
translated: He has the dance posture of half-lotus posture.

original: dpral ba dang / mgrin pa dang / snying gar aom a'a: h'um gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: dpral ba dang / mgrin pa dang / snying gar aom a'a: h'um gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Bless the forehead, throat, and heart with the three syllables oṃ āḥ hūṃ.

original: shes rab rdo rje rnal 'byor mas 'khyud pa /
analyzed: shes rab rdo rje rnal 'byor mas 'khyud pa /
translated: He is embraced by Prajñāvajra Yoginī.

analyzed: thugs kar sna tshogs rdo rje'i sting du yi ge h'um bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Meditate on the syllable hūṃ on a multicolored vajra at the heart.

original: de'i 'od zer gyis rang 'dra ba'i ye shes sems dpa' nam mkha' nas bkug ste bdag nyid la bstim par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis rang 'dra ba'i ye shes sems dpa' nam mkha' nas bkug ste bdag nyid la bstim par bya'o //
translated: Light rays from that invoke a gnosis being similar to oneself from space, which dissolves into oneself.

original: slar 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa lha lnga'i dkyil 'khor gyis bdag la dbang bskur ba dang mchod pa dang bstod par bsam mo //
analyzed: slar 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa lha lnga'i dkyil 'khor gyis bdag la dbang bskur ba dang mchod pa dang bstod par bsam mo //
translated: Again, light rays confer empowerment with the maṇḍala of the five deities of the tathāgatas, and imagine offerings and praises.

original: de nas bdud rtsi myang ba byas la /
analyzed: de nas bdud rtsi myang ba byas la /
translated: Then, having performed the tasting of the elixir,

original: chos sku ni 'di ltar dmigs par bya ste /
analyzed: chos sku ni 'di ltar dmigs par bya ste /
translated: one should visualize the dharmakāya as follows:

original: spyi bo dang mgrin pa dang snying ga dang / lte ba dang bde ba chen po dang / longs spyod dang sprul pa'i 'khor lo bsams te /
analyzed: spyi bo dang mgrin pa dang snying ga dang / lte ba dang bde ba chen po dang / longs spyod dang sprul pa'i 'khor lo bsams te /
translated: one should imagine the wheels of the crown, throat, heart, navel, great bliss, enjoyment, and emanation,

original: ham aom h'um aam ste de dag gi lte bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ham aom h'um aam ste de dag gi lte bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: and one should meditate on the centers of those wheels as being haṃ, oṃ, hūṃ, aṃ, and haṃ.

original: de nas srog dang rtsol ba'i sbyor bas /
analyzed: de nas srog dang rtsol ba'i sbyor bas /
translated: Then, by the union of prāṇa and āyāma,

original: aa las ye shes kyi me 'bar bas /
analyzed: aa las ye shes kyi me 'bar bas /
translated: the fire of gnosis blazes from the aṃ,🔽and the syllables previously arranged are burned.

original: sngar bkod pa'i ye ge bsreg bar byas nas ham gi bdud rtsi'i thig le 'bab par byas la lte bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bkod pa'i ye ge bsreg bar byas nas ham gi bdud rtsi'i thig le 'bab par byas la lte bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the drop of elixir from the haṃ falling to the navel.

original: de la sems gtad cing rtse gcig par byas te /
analyzed: de la sems gtad cing rtse gcig par byas te /
translated: One should focus the mind on that and make it one-pointed.

original: du ba la sogs pa'i rtags rnyed nas sprin med pa'i nam mkha' lta bu'i chos nyid mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i rtags rnyed nas sprin med pa'i nam mkha' lta bu'i chos nyid mngon du bya'o //
translated: Having obtained the signs of smoke and so on, one should actualize the dharmatā, which is like a cloudless sky.

original: de ltar ci nus su bya sla ma goms pa'i dbang gis gsal bar ma gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar ci nus su bya sla ma goms pa'i dbang gis gsal bar ma gyur na /
translated: If, due to the power of not being accustomed to doing it easily, it does not become clear,

analyzed: sngon bshad pa'i dpal he ru ka'i sku 'ja' tshon lta bu la dmigs te blta par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize the form of glorious Heruka like a rainbow, as explained before.

original: de'i bzlas pa ni /
analyzed: de'i bzlas pa ni /
translated: His mantra is:

original: aom hr'i: ha ha h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom hr'i: ha ha h'um h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ hrīḥ ha ha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

analyzed: ces pa 'di bzlas par bya'o // mchod @75a * //
translated: One should recite this.

analyzed: pa rnam pa lngas mchod la rang gi snying gar bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings with the five offerings and gather them into one's heart.

original: dpa' bo gcig pa'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: dpa' bo gcig pa'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Sādhana of the Sole Hero
